name: parachute
content:

B2 a piece of equipment made of a large piece of special cloth that is fastened to a person or thing that is dropped from an aircraft, in order to make him, her, or it fall slowly and safely to the ground See also
chute

parachute verb
(FROM AIRCRAFT)
[ I usually + adv/prep ] to jump from an aircraft using a parachute: The plan is to parachute into the town.
[ T usually + adv/prep ] to drop someone or something from an aircraft by parachute: [ often passive ] Thousands of leaflets were parachuted behind enemy lines.

parachute verb
(INTO SITUATION)
[ I or T + adv/prep ] to enter a situation without previously being involved in it, especially to offer temporary help, or to bring someone into a situation in this way : She parachutes into hospitals that desperately need nurses and stays three months or so. Before Hancock was parachuted in, sales had been falling consistently.
